domicile.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
domicile.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the country in which a person normally lives, and that is thought of as their permanent home
domicile.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Formerly the domicile of a wife was necessarily the same as that of her husband.
domicile.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a country in which a person decides to live, although it is not the country in which they were born
domicile.translation[1].definitions[1].e: If he marries a German woman, he has a domicile of choice in Germany.
domicile.translation[1].definitions[2].d: the country in which a person was born
domicile.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Every person receives at birth a domicile of origin.
